A bit dated now, but if you played half life 2, then its a must.

I'm going to get slated for this, but as someone who has only recently tried half life, i don't think that this game is as good now as it was considered when it first released. It still seems to play well even today, but i don't quite understand where all the hype has come from about the half life series, maybe from half life 2? its quite impressive that it still plays well for such an old game however, and if you can pick it up cheap you may as well have it for a rainy day. I don't think ill be rushing back to it with having so many other games i've yet to finish, but its not to say i wont ever play more of it.

98年，刚上小学一年级，那时候身边几乎没有人家里有电脑，去一个哥哥家里看到他在玩这个游戏，当时并不知道这个是什么，就是觉得很炫酷。后来2、3年级接触了cs，发现风格非常相似，但是无论我在cs里面怎么找，都找不到。
再后来才知道这是半条命，cs只是里面的资料片，因为种种原因，也有盗版盛行的原因，一直没有系统的去玩半条命系列。
现在2020，研究生快毕业了，也有了一些自己的积蓄，买正版游也变得方便，（隔离在也没事情- -），所以选择完成小时候没有完成的一个心愿。
半条命1整个花了两天，共计也就15小时，没有看攻略，中间多次被吓到，庆幸还好小学的时候没有玩。。。
抛开技术局限性，就算现在玩，也是神作，剧情，框架，地图设计，彩蛋等（看的羊羊君整理的彩蛋，真的对valve刮目相看）。虽然音效那么几个，虽然电脑操作的怪物和反派动作非常简单，但依然会被游戏本身所震撼。
半条命1就按发布顺序玩即可，各游戏中间会有各种彩蛋串联。
Game is amazing, it really made me feel like the Freeman.

The best FPS game I've ever played. Storyline, gameplay, sounds... It's just awsome! This game should be in every library.

This game's story is awesome. The gameplay might not have aged that well and there are some bugs (if there is a level transition in a vent, you won't be able to move at all). Surface Tension and Xen are by far the weakest parts of this game that just drag on, and the boss is just a simple "shoot until it's dead" type (which is something that this series really relies on). The combat is a double-edged sword, as it gives you fast movement and enemies that try to push forward. It's definitely a lot better than Half Life 2's mindless drones, but it doesn't allow you to reload at all, which can lead to many deaths. The HECU (I think that's their name) Soldiers are by far the most frustrating enemy to fight as they shoot you from any distance and lob grenades whenever they want. Now the grenade part wouldn't be as bad if you were fighting in a large space, but you mainly fight them in tight areas with barely any room to move around, so you end up getting hit anyway. They also spawn in groups of 3 or more, which makes it worse. Whenever you kill an enemy, their corpse still has collision for 3 seconds which creates even less room. Block pushing/pulling in this game sucks as pressing E on any block causes it to fly around the room. Autosaving isn't as frequent as it should be. Xen is extremely plain looking and doesn't feel like the end game area. I recommend playing on Easy to enjoy the game, Normal for a slightly harder experience, and Hard if you are into punishment. I recommend this game, but if you want to have a much more enjoyable experience just get Black Mesa.

So, at the time of writing this review it's 2020 I've been gaming for over two decades, I've picked up Half Life on and off twice but finally decided to finish the damn thing for the first time after checking out a full playthrough of HL: Alyx because I don't own VR equipment yet.

Half Life is pretty f***ing amazing! Even up against modern games I was still blown away by this game(played in 4K) so I can't even imagine what it must have been like to play this back when it originally released...(obviously not in 4K)
The gameplay was solid, the story was solid even despite there being obvious limitations on the in-game dialogue and cutscenes in that time of making games and overall it was just one hell of a game that, for obvious reasons, sent a huge ripple in the world of gaming and evolved into what it is today and the fandom that surrounds it.

I did encounter one or two bugs though, the main one when Gordon [spoiler] is being thrown into the trash [/spoiler] compactor, the game fades to black after being dragged and then I'm 'sitting' there in front of a conveyor in a dark room, I thought this was supposed to happen but a quick Google told me that it's not. So, I reloaded my save just before entering [i] that [/i] room and just mashed Space the entire time which worked and I fell into the spot I was meant to.

Anyway 10/10. Brilliant!

Born in 1996, and having first time playing this around ~2004 (didn't know shit back then, just playing the MP), and ultimately buying a legal version of it on Steam in ~2015 alongside every single half-life franchise available just to try why people saying this is a classic.

The first time I play, I've never touched any other games until I finished this.
After the first time I finished this, I've never played it again because every single thing happens inside this game is recorded clearly on my memory.

With those experience, I'm confident to say that HL defines [i][b]everything about being a classics.[/b][/i] 
Note that I'm playing through this game in the way how the game was meant to be played in 2015.

I can imagine FPS games in this modern era only consists of mass shooting enemies without any narrative background to it if there is no Half-Life.

I'm reviewing this on 2020 just to reminds me how the this OG is the starting point of the series, and without it, there is no HL2 and its episodes, HL:Alyx, and most importantly, the [i][b]Gondon's Journey to Borealis[/b][/i].

Half-Life is a game that revolutionized the entire FPS and gaming industry. The developers of Half-Life put hours into making such an immersive story. While the graphics are from the 90's they did the best they could back at that time. With this in mind people with lower end computers can still enjoy Half-Life as well with people with higher end computers can also enjoy the Half-Life experience. With everything combined your experience will be immersive. Half-Life still proves its relevance even in the 2020's. Many people are still playing this game to this day making this game still relevant in modern gaming as well. 

An instant 10/10.
